I think this is an amazing game that was really well executed. My only complaint with it has always been that it feels way too different from the first 2 Bioshock games to be considered a Bioshock game with the exception of the DLC. Though, this does not bring down the value of this game at all as it is one that I thoroughly enjoyed! The graphics are great and the gameplay is fast paced and fun! I would definitely recommend this to Bioshock fans! The darkness of it is a lot more subtle than in the first 2 installments.
Play the game and wipe away the debt.

Played it years ago, and reinstalled it last week and played it again.  For a game that is nearly 10 years old, it is beautiful, smooth and insanely creative.  Having only 2 weapons available to you at any given time forces you to swap out and use other weapons as you find them and ammo supplies deplete - which is different, but surprisingly expansive on the experience.  

I loved the story.  It spun webs into itself, but it was beautiful and sad and cryptic.  As often linear as the levels are forced to be, they don't always feel that way, and usually never _look_ that way.  The combat can be a bit too easy, I suppose, but I'm not a hard core player so I don't find that bothers me.  

Such a classic.
I see what they tried to do, it's just not for me. My husband loved it. It's just not Bioshock to me. It's not creepy and cool. Too bright and cartoony. Nice try.
I love the 1900 environmental setting and the AI companion.
What a beautiful game, in every shape possible -> (Elizabeth)

Jak dla mnie najlepszy Bioshock, nie ma siÄ™ do czego przyczepiÄ‡ poza tym, Å¼e jest niestety strasznie krÃ³tki i znajÄ…c fabuÅ‚Ä™ i wszelkie twisty raczej maÅ‚o zachÄ™cajÄ…ce jest ponowne przechodzenie tej gry, mimo to polecam w opÃ³r.

A good story can make you laugh, a good story can even make you cry. But only a GREAT story can make you sit silently in emotional disbelief while you run over everything in your head, trying to put it all together. And you always succeed in putting it together, because, after all it is a GREAT story, so its not convoluted, its intricate.

This game isn't a good story, its a GREAT story. 

 The cherry on top? The gameplay is excellent, play on hard for a serious challenge that will stay with you as one of your greatest moments in gaming. Jumping on and off skyhooks, gearswapping and  no-scoping with a sniper rifle while using your vigors correctly can be incredible fun if you are a skilled player. Casual players may find hard difficulty too challenging, but thats another GREAT thing about this game.  It has a very high skill ceiling for a FPS, so if youre more like me and you can take on hard right away cuz youre a total nerd, then you can enjoy the best Bioshock Infinite has to offer right away. And if youre more casual then you have it even better, because you can start on easy and work your way up. Giving you an excuse to see the excellent story a few more times.

This is up there with the original DOOM, Fallout NV, Mass Effect, Borderlands 2, Skyrim , and of course, the original Bioshock. If you consider yourself a "gamer" and you havn't played this yet, you are about to be SHOCKED.

Ok ya I made that pun...I'll see myself out.....

Really enjoyable game. As an American history nerd, this game has one of the best stories I've ever played, and I especially loved the tie-in with the Founding Fathers. Highly recommend at least one play through.
